intro: Micraira brevis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved micraira, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are typically less than 5 centimeters in length, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Micraira brevis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem, supporting various insect and microorganism populations.
